properties.areaDesc: Latimer, OK; Haskell, OK; Cherokee, OK; Muskogee, OK; Pittsburg, OK; McIntosh, OK; Sequoyah, OK
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 3:13PM CST until January 10 at 6:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for...
Central Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Eastern McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Northwestern Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma...
Northwestern Latimer County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Central Pittsburg County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Southeastern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma...
Eastern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma...

* Until 615 PM CST.

* At 312 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to
thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in
the advisory area. 1 TO 2 inches of rain have fallen.

* Some locations that may experience flooding include...
Mcalester...                      Tahlequah...
Sallisaw...                       Eufaula...
Stigler...                        Checotah...
Hartshorne...                     Krebs...
Warner...                         Vian...
Quinton...                        Gore...
Porum...                          Savanna...
Webbers Falls...                  Crowder...
Whitefield...                     Alderson...
Kinta...                          Marble City...

Additional rainfall of an inch is expected over the area. This
additional rain will result in minor flooding.

This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 262 and
303.
